subject: on and on forever
body:
1. "all the way down," the finale of the current season of futurama (hulu), which does these wonderful formally playful riffs on simulation theory and also ends in a beautiful way that feels like a different register than the one the show normally works in.

2. my blood work came back from the lab more quickly than expected (thankful i guess lol) and the numbers are still not great so i started this horrible new era by not having dessert last night and it was annoying but one day down (thankful i guess lol).

3. after an evening of trial and error in the attic i got my guitar tone—which had been driving me crazy lately and preventing me from making any actual music—into an acceptable state (which will last for a while and then eventually it'll sound wrong again and need hours of trial and error to get into an acceptable state, on and on forever)
normalized_markdown:
1. "all the way down," the finale of the current season of futurama (hulu), which does these wonderful formally playful riffs on simulation theory and also ends in a beautiful way that feels like a different register than the one the show normally works in.

2. my blood work came back from the lab more quickly than expected (thankful i guess lol) and the numbers are still not great so i started this horrible new era by not having dessert last night and it was annoying but one day down (thankful i guess lol).

3. after an evening of trial and error in the attic i got my guitar tone—which had been driving me crazy lately and preventing me from making any actual music—into an acceptable state (which will last for a while and then eventually it'll sound wrong again and need hours of trial and error to get into an acceptable state, on and on forever)
